Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Vase
Description: This vase was found in one of the rare intact burials of the Kerma necropolis at Sai. It was placed at the head of the deceased among pebbles and cosmetic paints. The clay is coarse, heterogeneous with a high percentage of organic and mineral (calcite ?) temper, black and has been polished. The base is rounded, the neck wide and curved, the lip fat and flared. This type of ceramic could have contained liquids.
